data.enText: write/draw
to write or draw a symbol, line, etc. on sth in order to give information about it

data.chText: 打星号的项目可以删去。
data.enText: Items marked with an asterisk can be omitted.
Prices are marked on the goods.

data.chText: 老师在她的名字旁做了个缺课的记号。
data.enText: The teacher marked her absent (= made a mark by her name to show that she was absent) .

data.chText: 你为什么批这道题为错？
data.enText: Why have you marked this wrong?

data.chText: 不要打开任何标有“机密”的邮件。
data.enText: Do not open any mail marked ‘Confidential’.
spoil/damage

data.chText: 留下痕迹；弄污；使有污点
data.enText: to make a mark on sth in a way that spoils or damages it; to become spoilt or damaged in this way

data.chText: 他的面颊上有一块大紫疤。
data.enText: A large purple scar marked his cheek.

data.chText: 这些台面是由不会留下污渍的材料做的。
data.enText: The surfaces are made from a material that doesn't mark.
show position
to show the position of sth

data.chText: 十字记号标明了发现死尸的地点。
data.enText: The cross marks the spot where the body was found.
The route has been marked in red.
celebrate
to celebrate or officially remember an event that you consider to be important

data.chText: 纪念战争结束50周年的庆典
data.enText: a ceremony to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of the war
show change

data.chText: 是…的迹象；成为…的征兆；表明
data.enText: to be a sign that sth new is going to happen

data.chText: 这篇演讲表明政府的政策可能会有变化。
data.enText: This speech may mark a change in government policy.

data.chText: 这一协议标志着国际关系新时期的到来。
data.enText: The agreement marks a new phase in international relations.
give mark/grade

data.chText: （给学生作业）打分，评分，评成绩
data.enText: to give marks to students' work
I hate marking exam papers.

data.chText: 我每周至少要花六个小时批改作业。
data.enText: I spend at least six hours a week marking.
give particular quality
to give sb/sth a particular quality or character
a life marked by suffering
He was marked as an enemy of the poor.
pay attention
used to tell sb to pay careful attention to sth

data.chText: 记住我的话，这件事是会有麻烦的。
data.enText: There'll be trouble over this, mark my words .
You mark what I say, John.
in sport
to stay close to an opponent in order to prevent them from getting the ball
Hughes was marking Taylor.

data.chText: 我方后卫已经紧紧地盯住了他。
data.enText: Our defence had him closely marked.
mark time
to pass the time while you wait for sth more interesting

data.chText: 我干这个工作只是在等待时机——我希望能从事新闻工作。
data.enText: I'm just marking time in this job─I'm hoping to get into journalism.
to make marching movements without moving forwards
mark you

data.chText: 无论如何；尽管如此；反正；然而
data.enText: used to remind sb of sth they should consider in a particular case

data.chText: 她还没取得什么成功，可是她非常努力。
data.enText: She hasn't had much success yet. Mark you, she tries hard.
mark sb down
to reduce the mark/grade given to sb in an exam, etc.

data.chText: 她因语法不好被扣了分。
data.enText: She was marked down because of poor grammar.
mark sb down as sth

data.chText: 将某人看作；认定某人为
data.enText: to recognize sb as a particular type

data.chText: 我当时还没有把他看作自由主义者。
data.enText: I hadn't got him marked down as a liberal.
mark sth↔down
to reduce the price of sth
All goods have been marked down by 15%.
to make a note of sth for future use or action

data.chText: 这家工厂已登记在案，准备拆除。
data.enText: The factory is already marked down for demolition.
mark sb/sth off (from sb/sth)

data.chText: 使与众不同；使有别于其他人（或物）
data.enText: to make sb/sth seem different from other people or things

data.chText: 伦敦的每个区都有鲜明的特征，与邻近地区不同。
data.enText: Each of London's districts had a distinct character that marked it off from its neighbours.
mark sth↔off
to separate sth by marking a line between it and sth else

data.chText: 运动场地用白线划了出来。
data.enText: The playing area was marked off with a white line.
mark sb out as/for sth
to make people recognize sb as special in some way

data.chText: 她被选定要尽早得到擢升。
data.enText: She was marked out for early promotion.
mark sth↔out

data.chText: 画出界限；画出边界；用线画出范围
data.enText: to draw lines to show the edges of sth

data.chText: 他们在草坪上标出网球场。
data.enText: They marked out a tennis court on the lawn.
mark sth↔up
to increase the price of sth

data.chText: 交易一开始，股票价格就涨上去了。
data.enText: Share prices were marked up as soon as trading started.
to mark or correct a text, etc., for example for printing
to mark up a manuscript
spot/dirt
a small area of dirt, a spot or a cut on a surface that spoils its appearance

data.chText: 孩子们把厨房的地板弄得污渍斑斑。
data.enText: The children left dirty marks all over the kitchen floor.

data.chText: 一块灼伤的 / 抓伤的疤痕
data.enText: a burn/scratch mark

data.chText: 侦探没有在尸体上发现任何痕迹。
data.enText: Detectives found no marks on the body.

data.chText: （人或动物身上有助于识别的）斑点，记号，色斑
data.enText: a noticeable spot or area of colour on the body of a person or an animal which helps you to recognize them
a horse with a white mark on its head

data.chText: 他身高约六英尺，没什么特别的记号。
data.enText: He was about six feet tall, with no distinguishing marks .
symbol

data.chText: 符号；记号；（显示质量、所有者等的）标记
data.enText: a written or printed symbol that is used as a sign of sth, for example the quality of sth or who made or owns it
punctuation marks

data.chText: 带有他的印记的每一件银器都极有价值。
data.enText: Any piece of silver bearing his mark is extremely valuable.

data.chText: 我在页边做了个记号来提醒我核对一下这个数字。
data.enText: I put a mark in the margin to remind me to check the figure.
sign

data.chText: （品质或情感的）标志，迹象，表示
data.enText: a sign that a quality or feeling exists

data.chText: 葬礼那天，各行业都停业以示敬意。
data.enText: On the day of the funeral businesses remained closed as a mark of respect .

data.chText: 在压力下仍能这样保持冷静，这就是冠军相。
data.enText: Such coolness under pressure is the mark of a champion.
standard/grade
a number or letter that is given to show the standard of sb's work or performance or is given to sb for answering sth correctly
to get a good/poor mark in English
to give sb a high/low mark
What's the pass mark (= the mark you need in order to pass) ?

data.chText: 我在拼写测验中得了个满分。
data.enText: I got full marks (= the highest mark possible) in the spelling test.

data.chText: “你打领带啦！”“你真眼尖，我给你打满分。”
data.enText: ‘You're wearing a tie!’ ‘ Full marks for observation.’
level
a level or point that sth reaches that is thought to be important

data.chText: 失业人数已突破四百万大关。
data.enText: Unemployment has passed the four million mark.

data.chText: 赛程到一半时是她领先。
data.enText: She was leading at the half-way mark.
machine/vehicle
a particular type or model of a machine or vehicle
the Mark II engine
in gas oven
a particular level of temperature in a gas oven
Preheat the oven to gas Mark 6.
signature

data.chText: （文盲在文件上代替签名的）花押
data.enText: a cross made on a document instead of a signature by sb who is not able to write their name
target
a target

data.chText: 仅有不到半数的出拳击中目标。
data.enText: Of the blows delivered, barely half found their mark.
to hit/miss the mark
German money
be close to/near the mark

data.chText: （猜测、陈述等）接近准确，几乎无误
data.enText: to be fairly accurate in a guess, statement, etc.
be off the mark

data.chText: （猜测、陈述等）不准确，相去甚远，离题
data.enText: not to be accurate in a guess, statement, etc.

data.chText: 不行，你根本没说到重点。
data.enText: No, you're way off the mark.
be on the mark
to be accurate or correct
That estimate was right on the mark.
get off the mark
to start scoring, especially in cricket

data.chText: 斯图尔特以一记四分球开始得分。
data.enText: Stewart got off the mark with a four.
hit/miss the mark

data.chText: 达到 / 没有达到目的；猜测正确 / 错误
data.enText: to succeed/fail in achieving or guessing sth

data.chText: 他满脸通红，罗宾一看便知道她击中了要害。
data.enText: He blushed furiously and Robyn knew she had hit the mark.
leave your/its/a mark (on sth/sb)

data.chText: 留下久远的影响（尤指坏影响）
data.enText: to have an effect on sth/sb, especially a bad one, that lasts for a long time

data.chText: 这样的痛苦经历一定会长期对孩子们有影响。
data.enText: Such a traumatic experience was bound to leave its mark on the children.
make your/a mark (on sth)
to become famous and successful in a particular area
not be/feel up to the mark
not to feel as well or lively as usual
on your marks, get set, go!
used to tell runners in a race to get ready and then to start
quick/slow off the mark

data.chText: （对形势的）反应敏捷 / 迟钝
data.enText: fast/slow in reacting to a situation
up to the mark
up to snuff
as good as it/they should be

data.chText: 你的工作没有真正达到要求。
data.enText: Your work isn't really up to the mark.
overstep the mark/line
to behave in a way that people think is not acceptable
wide of the mark
not accurate

data.chText: 他们的预测后来发现太离谱了。
data.enText: Their predictions turned out to be wide of the mark.
These are all words for a small part on a surface that is a different colour from the rest.
dot

data.chText: 指点、小点、小圆点，尤指印出来的点：
data.enText: a small round mark on sth, especially one that is printed
The letters ‘i’ and ‘j’ have dots over them.

data.chText: 这个岛在地图上是一个绿色的小点。
data.enText: The island is a small green dot on the map.
mark

data.chText: 指人或动物身上的斑、记号、色斑：
data.enText: a noticeable area of colour on the body of a person or animal
The horse had a white mark on its head.
spot
a small round area that is a different colour or feels different from the surface it is on
Which has spots, a leopard or a tiger?
a dot/mark/spot on sth
with dots/marks/spots
a blue/black/red, etc. dot/mark/spot

data.text: mark ♦ stain ♦ streak ♦ speck ♦ blot ♦ smear ♦ spot

data.chText: 以上各词均指污点、斑点、污迹。
data.enText: These are all words for a small area of dirt or another substance on a surface.
mark
a small area of dirt or other substance on the surface of sth, especially one that spoils its appearance

data.chText: 孩子们把厨房的地板弄得污迹斑斑。
data.enText: The kids left dirty marks all over the kitchen floor.
stain
a dirty mark on sth that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid
blood stains
streak
a long thin mark or line that is a different colour from the surface it is on
She had streaks of grey in her hair.
speck
a very small mark, spot or piece of a substance on sth
There isn't a speck of dust anywhere in the house.
blot
a spot or dirty mark left on sth by a substance such as ink or paint being dropped on a surface
smear
a mark made by sth such as oil or paint being spread or rubbed on a surface
spot
a small dirty mark on sth
There were grease spots all over the walls.
a streak/speck/blot/smear/spot of sth
a dirty mark/stain/streak/speck/smear/spot
an ink mark/stain/blot/spot
a(n) oil/grease/paint mark/stain/spot
to leave a mark/stain/streak/speck/blot/smear/spot
to get a mark/stain/spot out of sth

means: （给学生作业）打分，评分，评成绩
(人或动物身上有助于识别的)斑点，色斑
（品质或情感的）标志，迹象，表示

ex.chText: 在页边做个记号。
ex.enText: Make a mark at the margin.

ex.chText: 为什么这件银器上有他的印记？
ex.enText: Why does this piece of silver bear his mark?

synonyms.bx: 指写下来或印在物体上的记号。

ex.chText: ￡是表示英镑的符号。
ex.enText: ￡ is the sign for the British pound.

ex.chText: “+”表示加号。
ex.enText: '+' is the plus sign.

synonyms.bx: 指具有某种特殊含义的记号或形状。

ex.chText: 这些都是语音符号。
ex.enText: These are the phonetic symbols.

ex.chText: 铁的化学符号是哪个？
ex.enText: What is the chemical symbol for iron?

synonyms.bx: 指表示声音、数量、化学物质等的字母、数字或记号。

ex.chText: 一只脚印
ex.enText: the impression of a foot

ex.chText: 一棵倒下的树在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。
ex.enText: A fallen tree has left a clear impression in the hardening mud.

synonyms.bx: 指按压某一柔软表面所留下的痕迹。

ex.chText: 我汽车上有个凹痕。
ex.enText: There is a dent in my car.

ex.chText: 你看见门上那一大块凹坑了吗？
ex.enText: Did you see that large dent in the door?

synonyms.bx: 指因碰撞而在某物表面造成的凹陷痕迹。

ex.chText: 那个苹果上有咬过的痕迹。
ex.enText: There is a bite mark on the apple.

ex.chText: 她想知道为什么他的身上有几道抓痕。
ex.enText: She wanted to know why there were several scratch marks on his body.

synonyms.bx: 指割痕、孔洞或其他细小的损坏痕迹。

ex.chText: 比赛离终场还有两分钟时，双方比分为5比0。
ex.enText: The score was five-nil with two minutes left in the game.

ex.chText: 他阅读测验的成绩很令人失望。
ex.enText: His score on the reading test was very disappointing.

ex.chText: 这男孩的智商为126分。
ex.enText: The boy had an IQ score of 126.

synonyms.bx: 指运动、比赛、考试、科学测验等的得分。

ex.chText: 他英语得了一个Ａ，老师感到很惊讶。
ex.enText: The teacher was surprised that he got a grade A in English.

ex.chText: 她努力学习，取得了好成绩。
ex.enText: She worked hard and got good grades.

synonyms.bx: 指学习或考试成绩，通常用字母而非数字表示。

ex.chText: 我化学得了个B。
ex.enText: My mark in chemistry is B.

ex.chText: 她这学期的成绩略有提高。
ex.enText: Her marks have been a bit higher this term.

ex.chText: 他期终考试得了满分。
ex.enText: He got full marks on the final examination.

ex.chText: 及格分数是(百分制)60分。
ex.enText: The pass mark was 60%.

synonyms.bx: 尤指老师给学生的分数、成绩。

ex.chText: 他落后领先者2分。
ex.enText: He is two points behind the leader.

ex.chText: 如果你不能准时完成字谜就扣1分。
ex.enText: You lose a point if you can't complete the puzzle on time.

ex.chText: 他英语测验得了95分。
ex.enText: He got 95 points in the English test.

synonyms.bx: 主要指运动、比赛中的得分，有时也指考试的分数。

ex.chText: 你知道你的考试成绩吗？
ex.enText: Do you know your exam results?

ex.chText: 足球比赛的结果将在午夜公布。
ex.enText: The football results will be announced at midnight.

synonyms.bx: 指比赛的最终结果，或某一门考试的得分。

ex.chText: 她在今天的比赛中获得了创纪录的比分。
ex.enText: She made a record tally at today's game.

ex.chText: 目前英格兰队的积分是9分，苏格兰队是7分。
ex.enText: England's tally at the moment is 9 points, against Scotland's 7.

synonyms.bx: 指比赛等活动中到某一时间段的得分或积分。

data.enText: mark time
to pass the time while you wait for sth more interesting

data.chText: 我干这个工作只是在等待时机——我希望能从事新闻工作。
data.enText: I'm just marking time in this job─I'm hoping to get into journalism.
to make marching movements without moving forwards
mark you

data.chText: 无论如何；尽管如此；反正；然而
data.enText: used to remind sb of sth they should consider in a particular case

data.chText: 她还没取得什么成功，可是她非常努力。
data.enText: She hasn't had much success yet. Mark you, she tries hard.
be close to/near the mark

data.chText: （猜测、陈述等）接近准确，几乎无误
data.enText: to be fairly accurate in a guess, statement, etc.
be off the mark

data.chText: （猜测、陈述等）不准确，相去甚远，离题
data.enText: not to be accurate in a guess, statement, etc.

data.chText: 不行，你根本没说到重点。
data.enText: No, you're way off the mark.

to be accurate or correct
That estimate was right on the mark.
get off the mark
to start scoring, especially in cricket

data.chText: 斯图尔特以一记四分球开始得分。

data.chText: 这样的痛苦经历一定会长期对孩子们有影响。

data.enText: Your work isn't really up to the mark.

toe the line
toe the mark

data.chText: 顺从当局（或集体）；遵循…路线
data.enText: to say or do what sb in authority tells you to say or do, even if you do not share the same opinions, etc.
to toe the party line

data.chText: 他们的预测后来发现太离谱了。

data.chText: 交易一开始，股票价格就涨上去了。
data.enText: Share prices were marked up as soon as trading started.
to mark or correct a text, etc., for example for printing
to mark up a manuscript

trans: 把…归为（尤指反感的类型的人）
给（学生作业）扣分；降低…的分数

tr: something that exactly succeeds in achieving its goal
example: the new advertising campaign was a bell ringer
scored a bull's eye
hit the mark
the president's speech was a home run

tr: the impression created by doing something unusual or extraordinary that people notice and remember
example: it was in London that he made his mark
he left an indelible mark on the American theater

tr: a marking that consists of lines that cross each other
an indication of damage
a number or letter indicating quality (especially of a student's performance)
example: she made good marks in algebra
grade A milk
what was your score on your homework?

tr: a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
example: he showed signs of strain
they welcomed the signs of spring

tr: a symbol of disgrace or infamy
example: And the Lord set a mark upon Cain"--Genesi

tr: a visible indication made on a surface
example: some previous reader had covered the pages with dozens of marks
paw prints were everywhere

tr: a written or printed symbol (as for punctuation)
example: his answer was just a punctuation mark

tr: a reference point to shoot at
example: his arrow hit the mark

tr: a distinguishing symbol
example: the owner's mark was on all the sheep

tr: a person who is gullible and easy to take advantage of
formerly the basic unit of money in Germany
insert punctuation marks into
make or leave a mark on
example: the scouts marked the trail
ash marked the believers' foreheads

tr: mark by some ceremony or observation
example: The citizens mark the anniversary of the revolution with a march and a parade

tr: be a distinctive feature, attribute, or trait
sometimes in a very positive sense
example: His modesty distinguishes him from his peers

tr: assign a grade or rank to, according to one's evaluation
example: grade tests
score the SAT essays
mark homework

tr: put a check mark on or near or next to
example: Please check each name on the list
tick off the items
mark off the units

tr: remove from a list
example: Cross the name of the dead person off the list

tr: designate as if by a mark
example: This sign marks the border

tr: make underscoring marks
establish as the highest level or best performance
example: set a record

tr: make small marks into the surface of
example: score the clay before firing it

tr: mark with a scar
example: The skin disease scarred his face permanently

tr: attach a tag or label to
example: label these bottles

tr: notice or perceive
example: She noted that someone was following her
mark my words

tr: to accuse or condemn or openly or formally or brand as disgraceful
example: He denounced the government action
She was stigmatized by society because she had a child out of wedlock

value.def: A mark is a small area of something such as dirt that has accidentally got onto a surface or piece of clothing.

example.ex: The dogs are always rubbing against the wall and making dirty marks...
example.tran: 那些狗老是往墙上蹭，留下了斑斑污迹。

example.ex: A properly fitting bra should never leave red marks.
example.tran: 合适的胸罩不会留下红色勒痕。

value.def: If something marks a surface, or if the surface marks, the surface is damaged by marks or a mark.

example.ex: Leather overshoes were put on the horses' hooves to stop them marking the turf...
example.tran: 马蹄上套了皮套子，以免弄脏赛马场。

example.ex: I have to be more careful with the work tops, as wood marks easily.
example.tran: 我必须格外小心使用操作台，因为木头容易留下污迹。

value.def: A mark is a written or printed symbol, for example a letter of the alphabet.

example.ex: He made marks with a pencil.
example.tran: 他用铅笔做了记号。

value.def: If you mark something with a particular word or symbol, you write that word or symbol on it.

example.ex: The bank marks the check 'certified'...
example.tran: 银行在支票上标有“保付”的字样。

example.ex: Mark the frame with your postcode...
example.tran: 在这一格里写上你的邮政编码。

example.ex: For more details about these products, send a postcard marked HB/FF.
example.tran: 要了解这些产品的详细信息，请寄来标明HB/FF字样的明信片。

value.tran: 标示;为…作记号;为…作标记

value.def: A mark is a point that is given for a correct answer or for doing something well in an exam or competition. A mark can also be a written symbol such as a letter that indicates how good a student's or competitor's work or performance is.

example.ex: ...a simple scoring device of marks out of 10, where '1' equates to 'Very poor performance'...
example.tran: 简单的十分评分制，其中“1”即“极差”

example.ex: Candidates who answered 'b' could be awarded half marks for demonstrating some understanding of the process...
example.tran: 回答b的选手表明对这个过程有所了解，因此可以得到一半的分数。

example.ex: He did well to get such a good mark.
example.tran: 他表现不错，得了这么高的分数。

value.def: If someone gets good or high marks for doing something, they have done it well. If they get poor or low marks, they have done it badly.

example.ex: You have to give her top marks for moral guts...
example.tran: 你不得不对她维护正义的勇气竖起大拇指。

example.ex: His administration has earned low marks for its economic policies.
example.tran: 他的班子在经济政策上所获评价很低。

value.def: When a teacher marks a student's work, the teacher decides how good it is and writes a number or letter on it to indicate this opinion.

example.ex: He was marking essays in his small study.
example.tran: 他正在他那间小书房里批阅文章。

example.ex: For the rest of the lunchbreak I do my marking.
example.tran: 我在余下的午休时间里批改作业。

value.def: A particular mark is a particular number, point, or stage which has been reached or might be reached, especially a significant one.

example.ex: Unemployment is rapidly approaching the one million mark.
example.tran: 失业人数正迅速逼近百万大关。

value.def: The mark of something is the characteristic feature that enables you to recognize it.

example.ex: The mark of a civilized society is that it looks after its weakest members.
example.tran: 文明社会的特征是照顾最弱势群体。

value.def: If you say that a type of behaviour or an event is a mark of a particular quality, feeling, or situation, you mean it shows that that quality, feeling, or situation exists.

example.ex: It was a mark of his unfamiliarity with Hollywood that he didn't understand that an agent was paid out of his client's share...
example.tran: 他居然不知道经纪人的报酬得从其客户的收入中出，这说明他对好莱坞太不了解了。

example.ex: Shopkeepers closed their shutters as a mark of respect.
example.tran: 店主们暂时停业以示敬意。

value.tran: （品质、情感、情景的）标志，表现，迹象

value.def: If something marks a place or position, it shows where something else is or where it used to be.

example.ex: A huge crater marks the spot where the explosion happened.
example.tran: 巨大的弹坑标明了爆炸发生的地点。

example.ex: ...the river which marks the border with Thailand.
example.tran: 标明了与泰国分界线的河

value.def: An event that marks a particular stage or point is a sign that something different is about to happen.

example.ex: The announcement marks the end of an extraordinary period in European history...
example.tran: 声明标志着欧洲历史上一个伟大时代的终结。

example.ex: That programme received critical acclaim and marked a turning point in Sonita's career.
example.tran: 那个项目赢得了评论界的好评，成为索尼塔事业的转折点。

value.def: If you do something to mark an event or occasion, you do it to show that you are aware of the importance of the event or occasion.

example.ex: The four new stamps mark the 100th anniversary of the British Astronomical Association...
example.tran: 这四枚新邮票是为了纪念英国天文协会成立100周年而发行的。

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people took to the streets to mark the occasion.
example.tran: 数十万人走上街头庆祝这一时刻。

value.def: If a particular quality or feature marks something, it is a quality or feature which that thing typically has.

example.ex: Tragedy has marked Wilmette's life...
example.tran: 悲剧笼罩着薇尔梅特的一生。

example.ex: The style is marked by simplicity, clarity, and candor.
example.tran: 这种风格的特点是简洁、清楚、直截了当。

value.tran: 是…的特色;是…的典型特征

value.def: Something that marks someone as a particular type of person indicates that they are that type of person.

example.ex: Her opposition to abortion and feminism mark her as a convinced traditionalist.
example.tran: 她对堕胎和女权主义的反对态度表明她是个不折不扣的传统主义者。

value.tran: 将…归为;把…列为;给…确定性质

value.def: In a team game, when a defender is marking an attacker, they are trying to stay close to the attacker and prevent them from getting the ball.

example.ex: ...Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand, who so effectively marked Michael Owen.
example.tran: 成功盯住了迈克尔·欧文的曼联后卫里奥·费迪南德

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 guard, cover

example.ex: They had stopped Ecuador from building up attacks with good marking.
example.tran: 他们运用出色的盯人技术使厄瓜多尔队无法组织起进攻。

value.def: The mark was the unit of money used in Germany before it was replaced by the euro.

example.ex: The government gave 30 million marks for new school books.
example.tran: 政府拨款3000万马克用于购置学校的新教材。

posc.def: The mark was also used to refer to the German currency system.

example.ex: The mark appreciated 12 per cent against the dollar.
example.tran: 德国马克对美元升值了12%。

value.tran: 马克(德国使用欧元之前的货币单位)

value.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular temperature level in a gas oven.

example.ex: Set the oven  at gas mark 4.
example.tran: 将煤气炉开至4挡。

value.tran: (煤气炉上表示温度的)刻度，挡

value.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular version or model of a vehicle, machine, or device.

example.ex: ...his Mark II Ford Cortina.
example.tran: 他的福特葛天娜二代车

xrsa.xrsa_see: marked;marking;black mark;check mark;exclamation mark;full marks;high-water mark;punctuation mark;question mark;scuff mark;stretch marks

value.def: If someone or something leaves their mark or leaves a mark, they have a lasting effect on another person or thing.

example.ex: Years of conditioning had left their mark on her, and she never felt inclined to talk to strange men.
example.tran: 多年的熏陶对她影响很深，她从不愿意跟陌生人说话。

value.tran: 留下深刻的印记;留下深远的影响

value.def: If you make your mark or make a mark, you become noticed or famous by doing something impressive or unusual.

example.ex: She made her mark in the film industry in the 1960s.
example.tran: 她在20世纪60年代的电影界占有一席之地。

value.tran: 成就不凡;获得名望;成名

value.def: If you are quick off the mark, you are quick to understand or respond to something. If you are slow off the mark, you are slow to understand or respond to something.
value.tran: （理解力或反应）敏捷的/迟钝的，灵敏的/缓慢的

value.def: On your marks in British English, or on your mark in American English, is a command given to runners at the beginning of a race in order to get them into the correct position to start.

example.ex: On your marks—get set—go!
example.tran: 各就各位！预备！跑！

value.def: If something is off the mark, it is inaccurate or incorrect. If it is on the mark, it is accurate or correct.

example.ex: Robinson didn't think the story was so far off the mark...
example.tran: 鲁宾逊认为这个报道根本算不上离谱。

example.ex: He's right on the mark about movies being out of step with American culture.
example.tran: 他认为电影正在偏离美国文化的看法完全正确。

value.tran: 不正确;不得要领;不够贴切/完全正确;切中要害;十分贴切

value.def: If something is up to the mark, it is good enough.

example.ex: The workers get rid of those whose work is not up to the mark.
example.tran: 工人们赶走了工作不符合要求的人。

value.def: If something such as a claim or estimate is wide of the mark, it is incorrect or inaccurate.

example.ex: That comparison isn't as wide of the mark as it seems.
example.tran: 那种比较并非像看起来那么离谱。

value.def: You can say mark you to emphasize and draw attention to something you have just said.

example.ex: We're not extremists, mark you.
example.tran: 你听好了，我们不是极端分子。

trans: 标出；给…划界；使与众不同
满分；得满分；阅读理解满分；满分的；解满分
